title: ITRI Virtual Museum - Scene 8
content:
工研院線上展示館 │ ITRI Virtual Showroom
Tsung-Tsong Wu
Tsung-Tsong Wu has a bachelor’s degree in civil engineering from National Taiwan University (NTU) and obtained his master’s and Ph.D. degrees in theoretical and applied mechanics from Cornell University. Dr. Wu served as an associate professor, professor, Director, and Distinguished Professor at the Institute of Applied Mechanics at NTU. He was the Convener of the Aerospace Project at National Science Council, Executive Yuan; Deputy Executive Secretary of the Science & Technology Advisory Group; Deputy Minister of the National Science Council; President of the Society of Theoretical and Applied Mechanics of the Republic of China; Convener of the Science and Technology Group, New Frontier Foundation; Member of Atomic Energy Council and Minister without Portfolio at the Executive Yuan. He became the Minister of Science and Technology in 2020.

During his term as Minister without Portfolio, Dr. Wu assisted in promoting cross-agency technology-related government affairs and played an important role in promoting technology projects in Taiwan. As an active promoter of exchanges and collaborations between Taiwan and Japan, Dr. Wu assembled a Japan IoT and Cloud Application Service Delegation which consisted of representatives from the Board of Science and Technology, Executive Yuan; Small and Medium Enterprise Administration and Institute for Information Industry, Ministry of Economic Affairs; Information Service Industry Association of R.O.C.; Taipei Computer Association; and various businesses. The delegation visited Organization for Small & Medium Enterprises and Regional Innovation, JAPAN (SMRJ) and Japan Embedded Systems Technology Association (JASA). 

In 2016, Dr. Wu took on the role of ITRI’s twelfth Chairman. He worked with ITRI to assist local industries and established deeper ties with Southeast Asian partners such as Thailand, Malaysia, and Indonesia. Dr. Wu was also dedicated to promoting entrepreneurship and encouraged ITRI colleagues to build startups, serve as the mid-point for technology R&D and industries, and create new opportunities for emerging technologies.
生態樹 ─ 樹頂
● 生態樹的應用情境－光合作用
─ 概念說明：光合作用是植物利用陽光來製造能量(碳水化合物)的一種機制。

─ 技術應用情境：於生態樹上方天窗架設工研院研發之「太陽能發電窗」技術，用以展示太陽能發電窗利用陽光發電的情境。

─ 技術應用特色與效益：每片太陽能發電窗尺寸是110*90公分（約1平方米），發電量是18瓦；在生態樹示範面積內有20片，總發電量約360瓦。

● 生態樹的應用情境－淨化空氣
─ 概念說明：樹木透過光合作用中吸收二氧化碳與排放氧氣的過程，可達到淨化空氣的效果，此外植物散發的揮發性物質「芬多精」也可殺死空氣中的細菌、害蟲以及病原菌。

─ 技術應用情境：利用生態樹冠上塗層的自然光觸媒技術，來達到抵抗空間病菌及分解有機揮發氣體(VOC)的效果。

─ 技術應用特色與效益：樹冠內隱藏風扇可每小時讓整個空間換氣7次以上，並吹過光觸媒塗層區，淨化空氣。光觸媒抗菌效能可達99.99%，1g奈米光觸媒可分解20微克有機揮發性氣體（甲醛）。
The Newly Completed West Gate
The west gate of ITRI uses lightweight and transparent materials to express the sense of science and technology, showing the resemblance of a bird spreading its wings and soaring upward and forward. The lighting of the gate glows and shines in the Chutung area at night.
生態樹 ─ 樹幹
● 生態樹的應用情境－調節溫度
─ 概念說明：樹木也具有調節溫度的功能，透過樹蔭反射/阻隔/蒸散等功能，可調節冷熱空氣的對流與循環。

─ 技術應用情境：於生態樹上方天窗架設熱氣排出口，再利用太陽能發電窗所產生的電力，驅動生態樹冠上的風扇向下吹送，造成空間氣流的循環效果。

─ 技術應用特色與效益：位於樹冠內的六台風扇全開（1台由太陽能供電/5台由市電供電，每台出風量每分鐘57立方米），於中央挑高區容積(2,646立方米)，每小時可以將空氣循環約7.7次。

● 生態樹的應用情境－情境照明
─ 概念說明：樹木除了具有環境循環與調節的功能外，對人類來說還具有觀賞與造景功能。

─ 技術應用情境：利用擴散光板與LED燈結合之情境照明，搭配生態樹本身的藝術造型，來營造整個空間美學的藝術內涵。此外擴散光板與LED燈也可隨時因應日照變化調節室內光線。

─ 技術應用特色與效益：
生態樹擴散光板示範效能穿透度光約70%，霧度約30%；LED燈的耗電量約3,417瓦，相對於同樣光通量之彩色鹵素燈約14,903瓦，其耗電量只有23%。
“ITRI Laureate” honors eight tycoons for their industrial contributions
2012 ITRI Laureates:
TSMC Chairman and CEO Morris Chang, iD SoftCapital Group Chairman Stan Shih, Chien-Pang Venture Capital Corp. Chairman Ding-Hua Hu, Delta Electronics Founder and Honorary Chairman Bruce C.H. Cheng, ASUS Chairman Jonney Shih, Chang Chun Petrochemical Co., Ltd. Chairman and President Shu-Hong Lin, MediaTek Chairman and CEO Ming-Kai Tsai, and Epistar Corporation Chairman Biing-Jye Lee. (Titles are the ones held by the individuals at the time of the ceremony).
Jonq-Min Liu
Jonq-Min Liu received his bachelor’s degree in chemistry from National Tsing Hua University, and master’s and Ph.D. degrees from Columbia University. His field of study is organic photochemistry. After returning to Taiwan, he taught at Fu Jen Catholic University, National Central University, and National Tsing Hua University. In 1984, he joined ITRI and worked as a researcher, research director, principal researcher, Division Director, Deputy General Director, General Director, and Executive Vice President. Dr. Liu led Taiwan’s circuit board photoresist, flexible printed circuit, and LED industries into the global arena, laying down a solid foundation for Taiwan’s optoelectronic material field.

In 2015, Dr. Liu served as the eighth President of ITRI. He promoted the Open Innovation System Platform (OISP), which effectively connected ITRI, the industries, and education institutes with the world. He also brought in external resources to boost ITRI’s performance and facilitated joint interdisciplinary innovations. Dr. Liu was the Chairman of the Institute for Information Industry between 2016 and 2017.

Dr. Liu was the Chairman of the Taiwan Flat Panel Display Materials & Devices Association, Materials Research Society-Taiwan (MRS-T), and Chemical Society Located in Taipei. He served as the Main Project Director of Ministry of Economic Affairs (MOEA)’s Innovative Advanced Technology Research Project, and Director of Petrochemical Industry High-Value Promotional Office, MOEA. Due to his outstanding contributions to Taiwan’s material and chemistry industries, Dr. Liu was awarded the MRS-T Chih-Hung Lu Memorial Award in 2009, the Lifetime Achievement Award from The Polymer Society, Taipei in 2013, and Tung-Ho Outstanding Research Award in 2016.
生態樹 ─ 樹根
● 生態樹的應用情境－潔淨水質
─ 概念說明：樹木的根部具有涵養水源的功能，有一些水生植物則具有分解與浄化水質的功能。

─ 技術應用情境： Qwater為一模組化且可快速組裝之淨水系統，核心技術為生物膜濾技術，係結合「(生物)濾床區」和「薄膜分離區」之創新水與廢水處理系統。

─ 技術應用特色與效益：Qwater技術特別適用於原水或低濃度污水處理，適合應用於生活污水、工業廢水、洗車廢水、社區/學校簡易自來水等處理及中水回收等。
Ching-Yen Tsay
Ching-Yen Tsay received his bachelor's and master's degrees in atmospheric sciences from National Taiwan University (NTU), and an atmospheric sciences Ph.D. from the University of Utah. He did his postdoc research at the US National Center for Atmospheric Research and Harvard University. After returning to Taiwan, Dr. Tsay served as an associate professor, professor, and Chair of the Department of Atmospheric Sciences at NTU; Director-General of the Central Weather Bureau (CWB), Ministry of Transportation and Communications (MOTC); Director General of the Civil Aeronautics Administration, MOTC; Deputy Minister of the National Science Council; Minister without Portfolio and Convener of the Science and Technology Advisory Group at the Executive Yuan.

During his term as the Director-General of the CWB, Dr. Tsay brought in advanced weather forecasting technology to improve the accuracy of weather forecasting. Dr. Tsay became an American Meteorological Society Fellow in 1999 and was the first in Taiwan to receive this honor. In 2001, he received the title of the First Fellow of the Meteorological Society of the Republic of China.

In 2010, Dr. Tsay served as the eleventh Chairman of ITRI. During his term, he led ITRI to win many awards (including the R&D 100 Awards and The Wall Street Journal - Technology Innovation Awards) with innovative technologies and established an innovative system that was highly praised by the President's Council of Advisors on Science and Technology at the White House. In addition, Dr. Tsay actively promoted startups and encouraged colleagues to set up new companies to transfer advanced technology to the industry. With regard to international collaboration, Dr. Tsay promoted business cooperation between Taiwan and Japan to increase Taiwan’s international influence.
Jyuo-Min Shyu
Jyuo-Min Shyu received his bachelor’s and master’s degrees in electrical engineering from National Taiwan University and Ph.D. degree in electrical engineering and computer science from University of California, Berkeley. In 1988, he joined ITRI’s Electronics Industry Research Laboratories and served as a researcher, manager, Deputy Division Director, Division Director, Deputy General Director, Center Director, General Director, and Executive Vice President. Later he taught at National Tsing Hua University and worked as a professor of the Kwoh-Ting Li Lectures, Dean of the College of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, and Vice President of the University System of Taiwan. He became the Minister of Science and Technology in 2015.

In 2010, Dr. Shyu became the seventh President of ITRI. During his term, He initiated the transformation of the Electronic Research Laboratories and promoted advanced technology research. He established a new collaborative R&D model with the industries and facilitated the setup of R&D alliances for semiconductor intellectual property cores, system chips, and flat-panel displays. He singlehandedly created the Chip Center which was the first cross-domain technology R&D Center. In addition, Dr. Shyu encouraged cross-sectional R&D projects among biomedicine, green energy, and system software services. He also promoted green low-carbon demo zones and utilized technology to benefit social welfare.

Dr. Shyu is an IEEE Fellow and CSMOT Fellow and his expertise and management skills are widely recognized. He is a recipient of the MOEA Large Outstanding Principal Investigator Award, and the Taiwan IC Design Society Memorial Award of Professor Wen-Ren Shen.
Chih-Kung Lee
Chih-Kung Lee graduated from the Department of Civil Engineering at National Taiwan University (NTU) and obtained his master's and Ph.D. in theoretical and applied mechanics with a minor in physics from Cornell University. He also worked as a researcher at IBM Almaden Research Center in California. After returning to Taiwan, Dr. Lee taught at the Institute of Applied Mechanics at NTU as an associate professor, professor, and Distinguished Professor. He set up the MEMS Lab at the Institute, and also served as the Director of the Division of Strategic Planning, Office of Research and Development at NTU. Dr. Lee later worked as the Director of Biomedical Research & Development at the Hsinchu Biomedical Science Park Planning Office; Director-General of Engineering & Applied Sciences at the National Science Council, Executive Yuan; Consultant at the Taiwan Intellectual Property Training Academy; ITRI’s Executive Vice President; President of the Institute for Information Industry; Adjunct Research Fellow at the Research Center for Applied Sciences, Academia Sinica; Co-Chair of the University-Industry Advisory Committee, Ministry of Science and Technology; and Minister of Economic Affairs.

Dr. Lee’s area of research includes automation technology, optoelectronic and piezoelectric systems, and micro-electromechanical and biomedical technologies. In 2003 when the SARS epidemic broke out, Dr. Lee and his research team leveraged the biomedicine technology to develop “Taida No.1 anti-SARS chemicals” in 20 days.

In 2017, Dr. Lee became the thirteenth Chairman of ITRI. During his term, he actively connected the industry, government, academia, and research institutions. He implemented strategic planning and supervised organizational transformation to increase ITRI’s contribution to the industries, society, and nation. He also integrated research, service, and pedagogy to pass on the knowledge. In the field of R&D and industrial applications, he launched cross-domain integrations to help Taiwanese industries enter the international arena and gradually realize ITRI’s goal of using innovative technology to create new emerging markets for industries.
